p: Participants then received HIV risk reduction counseling and were offered a rapid HIV antibody test (Orasure), with reactive HIV tests confirmed by Western Blot. Participants with HIV infection (newly diagnosed and previously known infection) were asked to provide a blood sample to test for CD4 cell count and HIV viral load. A total of 10 mL blood sample was collected from the participants. Participants testing HIV-positive were referred for treatment and services. Participants who consented to blood storage had remaining serum samples aliquoted and stored frozen at -80Â°C. Participants were reimbursed $50 and a Metrocard for their time and transportation cost.
